text: The Big Sandy Subdivision is a railroad line owned and operated by CSX Transportation in the U.S. state of Kentucky. The line runs from Catlettsburg south to Elkhorn CityCSX Timetables: Big Sandy Subdivision along a former Chesapeake and Ohio Railway line.http://wiki.radioreference.com/index.php/BS- Big_Sandy_Sub CSX Huntington West Division Timetable At its north end, the Big Sandy Subdivision junctions with the Kanawha Subdivision, which heads east to West Virginia and Virginia and northwest to Ohio. The line continues from the south end as the Kingsport Subdivision; this was the historic change between the C&O; and Clinchfield Railroad. From north to south, the following line branch off, most to dead ends: *Dawkins Subdivision *Middle Creek Subdivision *E&BV; Subdivision (part of a continuous line to Winchester) *Coal Run Subdivision *SV&E; Subdivision ==References== Category:CSX Transportation lines Category:Rail infrastructure in Kentucky Category:Chesapeake and Ohio Railway Category:Johnson County, Kentucky Category:Transportation in Boyd County, Kentucky Category:Transportation in Pike County, Kentucky
title: Big Sandy Subdivision (CSX Transportation)
